forestr

Converting from Array to Data Frame and Viceversa

Mauro Lepore

2017-09-05

We need two functions to translate from one format to the other to fully explore the range of possibilities. (At least as tools to develop, not necessarily for the package).

–@gabrielato

library(forestr)
library(plyr)

stem <- bci12s6mini

From array to data frame

Example grouping by one variable.

# USING `abundance_n()`

x1 <- abundance_n(stem, group_by = c("sp"), only_alive = FALSE)
length(dim(x1))
#> [1] 1

head(x1)
#> 
#> acaldi aegipa alchco alibed allops alsebl 
#>     27      1     11      3      1     36
class(x1)
#> [1] "table"

head(as.data.frame(x1))
#>     Var1 Freq
#> 1 acaldi   27
#> 2 aegipa    1
#> 3 alchco   11
#> 4 alibed    3
#> 5 allops    1
#> 6 alsebl   36
# same
head(as.data.frame.array(x1))
#>        x1
#> acaldi 27
#> aegipa  1
#> alchco 11
#> alibed  3
#> allops  1
#> alsebl 36
# a little better
head(as.data.frame.table(x1))
#>     Var1 Freq
#> 1 acaldi   27
#> 2 aegipa    1
#> 3 alchco   11
#> 4 alibed    3
#> 5 allops    1
#> 6 alsebl   36

# The previous output is the closest to this "tidy" data frame:
head(n_dplyr_se(stem, "sp", only_alive = FALSE))
#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>       sp     n
#>    <chr> <int>
#> 1 acaldi    27
#> 2 aegipa     1
#> 3 alchco    11
#> 4 alibed     3
#> 5 allops     1
#> 6 alsebl    36



# SAME, USING `abundance_n2()`

x1 <- abundance_n(stem, group_by = c("sp"), only_alive = FALSE)

head(as.data.frame.table(x1))
#>     Var1 Freq
#> 1 acaldi   27
#> 2 aegipa    1
#> 3 alchco   11
#> 4 alibed    3
#> 5 allops    1
#> 6 alsebl   36

head(n_dplyr_se(stem, "sp", only_alive = FALSE))
#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>       sp     n
#>    <chr> <int>
#> 1 acaldi    27
#> 2 aegipa     1
#> 3 alchco    11
#> 4 alibed     3
#> 5 allops     1
#> 6 alsebl    36

Example grouping by one variable.

# USING `abundance_n()`

x2 <- abundance_n(stem, group_by = c("sp", "status"), only_alive = FALSE)
length(dim(x2))
#> [1] 2

head(x2)
#>         status
#> sp        A  D  G  P
#>   acaldi  4 11 10  2
#>   aegipa  0  1  0  0
#>   alchco  2  0  9  0
#>   alibed  1  1  0  1
#>   allops  0  1  0  0
#>   alsebl 20  2  9  5
class(x2)
#> [1] "table"

head(as.data.frame(x2))
#>       sp status Freq
#> 1 acaldi      A    4
#> 2 aegipa      A    0
#> 3 alchco      A    2
#> 4 alibed      A    1
#> 5 allops      A    0
#> 6 alsebl      A   20
# same
head(as.data.frame.array(x2))
#>         A  D  G P
#> acaldi  4 11 10 2
#> aegipa  0  1  0 0
#> alchco  2  0  9 0
#> alibed  1  1  0 1
#> allops  0  1  0 0
#> alsebl 20  2  9 5
# a little better
head(arrange(as.data.frame.table(x2), sp))
#>       sp status Freq
#> 1 acaldi      A    4
#> 2 acaldi      D   11
#> 3 acaldi      G   10
#> 4 acaldi      P    2
#> 5 aegipa      A    0
#> 6 aegipa      D    1

# The previous output is the closest to this "tidy" data frame:
head(n_dplyr_se(stem, c("sp", "status"), only_alive = FALSE))
#> # A tibble: 6 x 3
#>       sp status     n
#>    <chr>  <chr> <int>
#> 1 acaldi      A     4
#> 2 acaldi      D    11
#> 3 acaldi      G    10
#> 4 acaldi      P     2
#> 5 aegipa      D     1
#> 6 alchco      A     2



# SAME, USING `abundance_n2()`

x1 <- abundance_n(stem, group_by = c("sp"), only_alive = FALSE)

head(as.data.frame.table(x1))
#>     Var1 Freq
#> 1 acaldi   27
#> 2 aegipa    1
#> 3 alchco   11
#> 4 alibed    3
#> 5 allops    1
#> 6 alsebl   36

head(n_dplyr_se(stem, "sp", only_alive = FALSE))
#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>       sp     n
#>    <chr> <int>
#> 1 acaldi    27
#> 2 aegipa     1
#> 3 alchco    11
#> 4 alibed     3
#> 5 allops     1
#> 6 alsebl    36

as.data.frame.table() output is closest to a “tidy” data frame. This can also be done with plyr::adply(), but as.data.frame.table() is simplest.

From data frame to array

plyr can convert from class data.frame to class array.

df <- n_dplyr_se(stem, groups = c("sp", "status"), only_alive = FALSE)
head(df)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 3
#>       sp status     n
#>    <chr>  <chr> <int>
#> 1 acaldi      A     4
#> 2 acaldi      D    11
#> 3 acaldi      G    10
#> 4 acaldi      P     2
#> 5 aegipa      D     1
#> 6 alchco      A     2
a <- daply(df, .(sp, status), nrow)
head(a)
#>         status
#> sp        A  D  G  P
#>   acaldi  1  1  1  1
#>   aegipa NA  1 NA NA
#>   alchco  1 NA  1 NA
#>   alibed  1  1 NA  1
#>   allops NA  1 NA NA
#>   alsebl  1  1  1  1
class(a)
#> [1] "matrix"

With three grouping variables (using another dataset for simplicity)

example_years <- c(1938, 1956, 1909, 1992)
example <- dplyr::filter(baseball, year %in% example_years)

# grouping by year, team and stint, to show array of 3 dimensions
groups <- c("year", "team", "stint")
(a <- daply(example, .variables = groups, .fun = nrow))
#> , , stint = 1
#> 
#>       team
#> year   ATL BAL BOS BRO BSN CAL CHA CHN CIN CLE DET HOU KC1 KCA LAN MIN ML1
#>   1909  NA  NA   4   2   2  NA   3   9   3   3   8  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1938  NA  NA   9   5   6  NA   9  12   4  10   7  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1956  NA   6   7   6  NA  NA  14   5  10  12  13  NA   8  NA  NA  NA  11
#>   1992  16  14  12  NA  NA  12   9  15  11  11   9  10  NA  11  21   8  NA
#>       team
#> year   ML4 MON NY1 NYA NYN OAK PHA PHI PIT SDN SEA SFN SLA SLN TEX TOR WS1
#>   1909  NA  NA  10   6  NA  NA   7   4   4  NA  NA  NA   3   3  NA  NA   6
#>   1938  NA  NA   6   7  NA  NA   5   4   4  NA  NA  NA   4  10  NA  NA   8
#>   1956  NA  NA   6  13  NA  NA  NA  10  10  NA  NA  NA  NA  11  NA  NA   7
#>   1992  14  16  NA  14  10  16  NA   7  10  11   9  12  NA  13  14  20  NA
#> 
#> , , stint = 2
#> 
#>       team
#> year   ATL BAL BOS BRO BSN CAL CHA CHN CIN CLE DET HOU KC1 KCA LAN MIN ML1
#>   1909  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA   1  NA  NA   1  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1938  NA  NA  NA   1  NA  NA  NA  NA   1  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1956  NA   7  NA  NA  NA  NA   2  NA  NA  NA   1  NA   1  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1992   2  NA   1  NA  NA   2  NA  NA  NA   1  NA  NA  NA   3  NA  NA  NA
#>       team
#> year   ML4 MON NY1 NYA NYN OAK PHA PHI PIT SDN SEA SFN SLA SLN TEX TOR WS1
#>   1909  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA   3
#>   1938  NA  NA  NA   1  NA  NA  NA   2   1  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA   1
#>   1956  NA  NA   1   1  NA  NA  NA   3   2  NA  NA  NA  NA   5  NA  NA  NA
#>   1992  NA   1  NA  NA   3   3  NA   3   1  NA   3  NA  NA  NA   2   1  NA
#> 
#> , , stint = 3
#> 
#>       team
#> year   ATL BAL BOS BRO BSN CAL CHA CHN CIN CLE DET HOU KC1 KCA LAN MIN ML1
#>   1909  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1938  NA  NA  NA   1  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1956  NA   1  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1992  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>       team
#> year   ML4 MON NY1 NYA NYN OAK PHA PHI PIT SDN SEA SFN SLA SLN TEX TOR WS1
#>   1909  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1938  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1956  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
#>   1992  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA  NA
is.array(a)
#> [1] TRUE
